ğŸ§¡ HUBSPOT CELEBRATES PRIDE ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ For the month of June, HubSpot is proudly celebrating Pride with a month-long programming designed to educate, connect, and bring our community together. Among the highlights, we're thrilled to participate in the Inclusive Careers Fair and honored to have Theresa Goh, BBM, PLY feature in our Pride Speaker Series. Additionally, we embarked on an insightful Inclusivity Walking Tour with PrideCommunity.co, led by Isaac Tng â˜€ï¸ I highly recommend this tour for anyoneâ€”individuals or corporate teamsâ€”interested in exploring the rich queer history of Singapore. Queer erasure is a significant issue here, often leaving these stories absent from mainstream media. The tour provided eye-opening insights that were both valuable and thought-provoking, prompting deeper reflection on how we can be better allies. Well, even as a gay person, a lot of the things shared in this tour are new information to me. (I'll share the link to the tour in the comment section below) Two weeks ago, we also hosted a ğŸŒˆ Pride-Themed Lunch featuring a delicious spread from Amici Events and Catering, a long-time supporter of the Red Dot for Pink Dot - RD4PD movement (We wanted to give back). We added a creative twist by giving the dishes conversation-provoking queer names, such as "Drag Queen Potion", "Pansexual Penne Paradise", "Lesbian Laksa Love", and "Queeramisu Extravaganza" to name a few. It certainly sparked engaging discussions about different queer terms, giving everyone a light-hearted opportunity to learn. âœ¨ Celebrating Pride at HubSpot this month has been incredible, but our commitment to inclusivity and allyship doesnâ€™t end here. Every day is an opportunity to celebrate and support the LGBTQ+ community and individuals, building a safe and inclusive workplace for all to thrive. #hubspotlife #pridemonth #pride2024 #lgbtq #communityfirst #peoplefirst #workplaceculture #deib #inclusion #celebration

ğŸŒˆ CELEBRATING WINS & PROGRESS ğŸ‘ Thank you to Pinterest for having me at your first-ever Pride Month celebration in Singapore - never too late to start ğŸ¤— It's incredibly heartwarming to see more companies coming forward to celebrate Pride, learn more about the community, and commit to building a more inclusive workplace. During the event, I had the privilege to share my personal journey of coming out and navigating life as a gay individual in Singapore. From the highs of self-acceptance to the challenges of cultural and societal norms, each step has shaped my understanding of resilience and authenticity. I share my lived experience and story quite a lot, but whenever I do so, it's a profound moment of reflection. Each opportunity allows me to revisit my journey, appreciating the progress and celebrating the victories that have shaped who I am today. Yes, it is not always gloom and doom - there are a lot of wins to celebrate, and we should! ğŸ’ ğŸ’• One of the most significant joys has been finding love and planning our Singapore weddingâ€”an affirmation of love's power to transcend barriers and redefine norms. Another win is the freedom to bring my best and most authentic self to work, free from fear and judgment, while continuing to flourish professionally. I'm incredibly grateful to platforms like Pinterest for providing spaces where diverse voices can shine and stories can inspire change. Thank you Fiona Huang for moderating the panel and making it easy and safe for me to share with much vulnerability. #pridemonth #pinterest #lgbtq #deib #diversityandinclusion #inclusionmatters #communityfirst #workplaceculture #singapore

ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¬ SINGAPORE GAY WEDDING ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ Family means everything to usâ€”both our biological families and the chosen family weâ€™ve built over the years. Their love and support have made this moment even more significant and special. Having their blessings at our Singapore wedding has filled our hearts with immense joy and gratitude. With their love and support, that is all that matters. Growing up gay is not easy. We understand that it can be even harder for parents of queer children, who may experience shame, guilt, and worry when we first come out. Our parents had to navigate their own "coming out" journey, opening up to friends and family about having a queer child too. So we do deeply appreciate our parents for accepting us for who we are and being at the wedding to give us their true blessings. A highlight of our wedding was having my nephew (10yo) and niece (4yo) attend. Before the event, I was quite hesitant and worried about how to explain to them that the wedding they were about to attend was a gay wedding. We hadn't really "come out" to the kids, though they had seen us together as a couple over the years. ğŸŒˆğŸ¥¹ However, during the wedding, when I saw them both waving the rainbow flag, wearing pride pins on their shirt and dress, and treating us just like they always had, all those worries vanished. Children are naturally naive and pure, free from the prejudices that adults often carry. They accept people for who they are without judgment or bias. Itâ€™s usually the adults who impose their own fears and biases onto children. Seeing my nephew and niece embrace our wedding with such innocence and joy reminded me of this beautiful truth. Special thanks to my sister for being a progressive parent, educating and raising her children with such openness and love. Thanks to our family for being the most progressive, loving, and inclusive support system we could ever ask for. ğŸ¡â¤ï¸ Weâ€™ll never take that for granted! Happy Pride everyoneâœ¨ğŸ’– #family #wedding #gaywedding #marriage #inclusivity #inclusionmatters #deib #pridemonth #lgbtq #equality

ğŸ³ï¸ğŸŒˆ WHY PRIDE MONTH IS IMPORTANT ğŸ³ï¸âš§ï¸ As we enjoy Pride Month celebrations, it's important to think about what Pride really means. It's not just about fun parades and parties; it's a poignant reminder of the enduring struggle for equality and acceptance. For many of us, being able to embrace our identity openly is a privilege we often take for granted. For many LGBTQ+ people all around the world, just being who they are can be really risky. They face discrimination, violence, and unfair treatment because of who they love or how they identify themselves. ğŸ’¡ Let's take a moment to consider the stories of those who live in fear simply because of who they love or how they identify. Imagine the anguish of a young person ostracized by their community for daring to be authentic. Picture the heartbreak of a family torn apart by prejudice and misunderstanding. Think of the kids who got bullied so much for being different and unfortunately took their lives due to lack of support and the immense trauma they went through. These are not hypothetical scenarios; they are the harsh realities faced by LGBTQ+ individuals every single day. Before we jest about the notion of a "Straight Pride" parade, let's pause and reflect on the significance of Pride itself. It emerged as a defiant stance against the forces of discrimination and marginalization. It serves as a beacon of hope for those who have been made to feel invisible and ashamed. Our journey towards true equality is far from over. While we celebrate the progress we've made, we must also acknowledge the work that lies ahead. Let's amplify the voices of those who continue to fight for their rights, both here at home and across the globe. â¤ï¸ğŸ§¡ğŸ’›ğŸ’šğŸ’™ğŸ’œ Let's stand in solidarity with our LGBTQ+ siblings, affirming their right to love and live authentically. Together, we can create a world where everyone is celebrated for who they are, regardless of whom they love or how they identify. May the Pride be with you! ğŸŒŸ #pridemonth #lgbtq #equality #humanrights #authenticity #inclusionmatters #deib #inclusion #diversity
